dialogue: Daddy, the kitchen's asking if we could please go ahead and take our seats.
This is Harry's twin sister, Maggie.
Hello, Mr. Toth. We love the library.
Don't be impatient! It isn't far.
As you all know, these last years have been especially hard on Harry, Maggie, and myself.
Daddy, it's very cold out here. Shouldn't we go back inside?
Quiet for a moment, Maggie... I brought you all here this evening, not to glance over my shoulder towards the past, but to invite you to look forward with me towards the future!
On the other side of that hill is Doylestown. It is on this site near our own family plot that we plan to build a center for the community in honor of Margaret Lee Van Buren!
Extraordinary. Your grandmother loved marble. Maggie will you call for some coffee?
I think it's beautiful, Mr. Toth.
Isn't it?
Erzsebet- pardon me, am I pronouncing that correctly?
Maggie, you're exaggerating.
I AM NOT, I swear it! They looked exactly like that popular painting, you know the one-?
For context, her husband is among Van Buren Steel's most important private clients.
Daddy tried to explain everything that had made us late as she prepared for us what appeared to be a delightful looking little trifle!
Indeed.
He began gagging like a house cat!
And all he could say to explain was...
`Dear... I am allergic.' to which our concerned hostess replied, ` allergic to what?!', and he says...
`TO THAT. I am very allergic to whatever THAT is.'
Your husband is sick. He is an alcoholic and a drug addict. I don't know why he wishes to hurt me, humiliate me.
I have offered him nothing but kindness. He's a sick, senile old dog and when dogs get sick, they often bite the hand that's fed them before someone mercifully puts them down.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I've withstood enough abuse for one evening. You can tell your husband he's off the payroll now and forever, as well.
Stop it, Harry!
Stop it, Harry!
